Description: Seal; intaglio; black basalt stoneware; oval; head to right of Hermes Trismegistus, a priest and philosopher of Egypt, or possibly Mercury with a caduceus; reverse, with impressed model number and maker's mark.
Curator's comments: The design source for the image is no. 2310, in the Tassie and Raspe catalogue 1791, described as 'Chalcedony... A bust, with a beard, diadem, and caduceus, which we place here, since there are a number of bearded Mercurys; upon which may be consulted Winck. Cat. de Stosch. p. 96. Mr. Lippert (Dactyl. I. no..58) judging from an incomplete impression without a caduceus, thinks that it is a Neptune Plate XXX. Wedgwood had no confusion and identifies model number 232 as 'Hermes Trismegistus --- head.' (tr. Hermes the Thrice-Greatest), in the 1779 Wedgwood and Bentley catalogue, and the 1787 Wedgwood catalogue.
Bibliographic references: Hobson 1903 / Catalogue of the collection of English Pottery in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquites and Ethnography of the British Museum (I421)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
